Text: (Verse 1)
In the heart of a nest, high up in an old oak tree,
Lies a small bird, dreaming what he might be.
He stares at the sky, so vast and so wide,
Longing for the day, when he'll join the birds outside.

(Chorus)
Oh, to fly like a bird, on wings strong and free,
To dance with the wind, over land and sea.
With every beat of his heart, each flutter of feather,
He's learning to soar, lighter than a tether.

(Verse 2)
The day has arrived, he steps onto the edge,
Feeling the breeze, flowing past the hedge.
A leap of faith, into the azure yonder,
His heart is filled with awe and wonder.

(Chorus)
Oh, to fly like a bird, tasting sweet liberty,
Exploring the world, from mountain to quivery.
With every gust of wind, under the sun's golden ray,
He's embracing the joy, of this glorious day.

(Bridge)
Every treetop, every cloud, every star shining bright,
Is now within reach, oh what a sight!
No cage can hold him, no chain can bind,
He's found his freedom, left all fears behind.

(Chorus)
Oh, to fly like a bird, feeling alive and spry,
Touching the heavens, kissing the sky.
With every breath he takes, every song he will trill,
He's living his dream, flying at will.

(Outro)
So here's to the bird, who dared to ascend,
May your journey be long, may it never end.
Keep chasing the horizon, keep reaching for the blue,
For you are a testament, that dreams do come true.
